Example Code
The SDK contains a set of example applications that show how to interface with the Xsens Device API. These examples can be found in the Examples directory of the MT SDK. The path to he MT SDK is represented by the MTSDK environment variable.

To access the directory under Windows use 

%MTSDK%\Examples


For Linux use 

$MTSDK\Examples


The example directory consists of several sub directories. The following describes shortly the contents per sub directory:
DLL Example:

This directory contains a visual studio solution with 3 examples:

  • XsensDeviceAPI Dll MTix and MTmk4 X example:
    Simple application that shows how to get live orientation data from an MTi device. There are two projects for this example. A C++ and a C version
  • XsensDeviceAPI Dll Xbus Master X Example:
    Simple application that shows how obtain raw data from devices connected to an Xbus Master. For this example there are also two projects. A C++ and a C version
  • XsensDeviceAPI Dll Example:
    A more elaborate example that interfaces with all kinds of Xsens devices through a console GUI. This example is only available in C++
Matlab

This directory contains a Matlab example that shows how to interface with Xsens Devices. It uses the COM interface.

bin

This directory contains precompiled version of the examples
